p: In the ESCOP monograph, the acute oral LD 50 of caraway oil in rats was reported from two different studies as 3.5 and 7.4 mL/kg, respectively. The acute dermal LD 50 of caraway oil in rabbits was reported as 1.8 mL/kg. Intra-peritoneal, intravenous LD 50 of d-carvone in mice were 482.2 and 1500 mg/kg, the oral LD 50 of d-carvone in rats and guinea pigs were 1640 and 766 mg/kg. ADI (Acceptable Daily Intake) for d-carvone was 0–1 mg/kg/day [ 90].
